title: build_cellranger_arc_reference
description: Build a Cell Ranger-arc and -atac compatible reference folder from user-supplied genome FASTA and gene GTF files. Creates a new folder named after the genome.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

genome_fasta.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `genome_sequence.fa.gz`. Reference genome fasta
genome_fasta.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `genome_sequence.fa.gz`. Reference genome fasta.

motifs_file.description: Type: `file`, example: `JASPAR2024_CORE_non-redundant_pfms_jaspar.txt.modified`. Transcription factor motifs in JASPAR format
motifs_file.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `JASPAR2024_CORE_non-redundant_pfms_jaspar.txt.modified`. Transcription factor motifs in JASPAR format. See https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-multiome-atac-gex/software/pipelines/latest/advanced/references

non_nuclear_contigs.description: Type: List of `string`, default: `chrM`, example: `chrM`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Name(s) of contig(s) that do not have any chromatin structure, for example, mitochondria or plastids
non_nuclear_contigs.help_text: Type: List of `string`, default: `chrM`, example: `chrM`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Name(s) of contig(s) that do not have any chromatin structure, for example, mitochondria or plastids. These contigs are excluded from peak calling since the entire contig will be "open" due to a lack of chromatin structure. Leave empty if there are no such contigs.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `cellranger_reference`. Output folder
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `cellranger_reference`. Output folder

genome.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `GRCh38`. Name of the genome
genome.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `GRCh38`. Name of the genome. This will be the name of the intermediate output folder

organism.description: Type: `string`, default: `Homo_sapiens`. Name of the organism
organism.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `Homo_sapiens`. Name of the organism. This is displayed in the web summary but is otherwise not used in the analysis.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
